newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Sao Paulo industrial activity up 13 pct in June.
newsitem.headline: Sao Paulo industrial activity up 13 pct in June.

text.p: Sao Paulo state's industrial activity rose 13 percent in June, compared with same period the year before, the Sao Paulo State Industries Federation (Fiesp) said.

The sharp rise in the industrial activity was due partly to the higher number of working days in June this year, which had 21 working days compared with just 19 in June 1996, Fiesp said in a statement.
Last month's industrial activity also rose 3.9 percent when compared with May.
Industrial sales rose 18.6 percent in June against the same month in 1996, and 3.7 percent compared with May this year, it added.
